alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 08 at 5:00PM MST until August 08 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 545 PM MST. * At 458 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from La Palma to 8 miles southeast of Florence to 10 miles southwest of Kearny, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 179 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 170 and 178. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 124 and 150. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Florence, Coolidge, Arizona City, La Palma, Blackwater, Toltec, Arizola, Randolph, Coolidge Airport, Valley Farms, and Sacaton. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
